723939f-a.text:
Wall Street, west from Pearl Street, to Broadway, showing an early view of Manhattan's financial center. Trinity Church at the furthest point dominates this locale. Intersections observable at the left are, Hanover, William and Broad Streets. Note the ornate Drexel Morgan Bldg. at the latter point. This feature erected in 1872 when taken in conjunction with the absence of the National Bank of the Republic (1880) at Broadway,
dates this scene.
Between 1872-80

Gift of Urbrock Collection
723939f-a.folder: Wall Street & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY

723941f-a.text:
Wall Street, south side, west from Pearl to Broad Streets, showing at the S.W. corner of the latter point the 22-story N.Y. Stock Exchange Building. The low 4-story structure on the opposite corner (S.E.) is
the J.P. Morgan and Co. Building.
May 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

723937f-a.text:
74-76 Wall Street at the N.E. corner of Pearl Street.
June 1925.
723937f-a.folder: Wall Street & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY

723938f-a.text:
74-76 Wall Street, at the N.W. corner of Pearl Street. This view shows the entrance of the Seaman's Savings Bank.
About 1926.
723938f-a.folder: Wall Street & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY

723932f-a.text:
54-56 Wall Street, north side, between Pearl and William Streets, as viewed northward on Hanover Street. The clearance in the foreground is for the new 35-storied Wall and Hanover Building which will replace the former 3 and 8-story Brown Brothers and Co. Building that stood here. On the left appears the east side of the block square National City Bank and occupying the west side of this street, from Exchange Place to Wall Street.
June 30, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
723932f-a.folder: Wall Street & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY

723944f-a.text:
Wall Street, north side, west from, but not including Pearl Street. The Bank of New York (No. 48) is shown under construction; Adjacent to same on the east is the 31 story National City Building (No. 52). To the left of these two new buildings are,the early Bank of Manhattan Building, the pyramidal Bankers Trust Company Building and the massive New York Stock Exchange Building. In the left foreground is the quadrangular National City Bank. At the extreme right is the 16 story building. No. 60-62 that is occupied by H. L. Dougherty and Company.

About 1928

S. G. Cleveland
723944f-a.folder: Wall Street & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY

723943f-a.text:
Wall Street, at the N.W. corner of Pearl Street. Also shown is Pearl Street, west side, north from Wall, to and including Pine Street. The view shows the Second and Third Ave., elevated structure on Pearl Street.

This is the new building of K Seamens Bank for Savings.
About 1929.
Underwood & Underwood.
